result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Singleton, Terry D
defendant.address: 4120 South Lake Drive, Saint Francis, WI 53235

records.addlTxt:
ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD VIA EMAIL. 
Case calendared for a Plea Hearing. Defendant in custody.
Court is in trial and ordered plea hearing adjourned.
New date confirmed with parties via email.
Case calendared in Branch 19.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Terry D Singleton not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Terry D Singleton.  
Attorney Fransesco Mineo for Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling conference.  Defense requests a tentative plea hearing. 
Court ordered case adjourned back to Branch 19. Plea hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Terry D Singleton not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requested an additional scheduling conference date. Court granted the defenses request. Case adjourned to Branch 45.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means. Case was mistabbed to Branch 16. Case is adjourned in Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Terry D Singleton in court, defendant in custody with attorney Robert J Hampton appear by video.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  Court ordered random drug testing.

Defendant Terry D Singleton in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Terry D Singleton in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
